intro: Diplotaxis tenuisiliqua subsp. tenuisiliqua, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual with erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has pinnately lobed leaves that are typically hairy and adapted to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
